cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi south-southeast of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west today, then turning WNW to NW toward the central/southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (central LA coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, LA (Tropical-Storm); Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach (Storm-Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) expected Friday, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts Friday night into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 3–6 ft possible along Plaquemines and adjacent coasts, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Extreme rainfall of 10–15 inches with locally 20 inches possible, producing flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning tonight and Friday; prolonged power outages and road closures likely.
